problem_text: Let p be a prime and n be an integer with p > 2n + 1. Let x, y be p-elements in GLn(C). If the subgroup ⟨x, y⟩ is finite, then it is an abelian p-group (W. Feit, J. G. Thompson, Pacif. J. Math., 11, no. 4 (1961), 1257–1262). What can be said about ⟨x, y⟩ in the case it is an infinite group? J. D. Dixon
